channel.description: Recent content in Astrobiology on ScienceChronicle

item.title: Rocky Planet in Remote Double Star System Could Have Water Oceans on Surface
item.description: On 12 May 2023, Cape Town Observatory scientists released a report regarding the possibility of a rocky planet in a remote double star system having water oceans on its surface. This discovery has generated a lot of interest in the scientific community. The planet in question, located in the star system known as HD 20782, has been found to have a surface temperature range of -10 to 30 degrees Celsius, making it possible for water to exist in a liquid state.
